revised_title: Determination of Refraction-Equivalents in Metal Salts
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the refraction-equivalents of metal salts by examining their compounds. They found that the refraction-equivalent of a compound is the sum of the refraction-equivalents of its constituents. The author also discovered that the refraction-equivalents of metal salts differ based on the nature of the electro-negative constituents. This research provided insights into the optical properties of metals and their compounds.
